column3: ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16453/commits/fa219951be716c6e0e74c9fab823346ace3ac18b\n\nThis restores the original behavior before #16194. Wonder why the failures we saw were intermittent, though.
> Wonder why the failures we saw were intermittent, though.\n\nYes, I don't really like my change. Ideally `CheckBlockIndex` passes any time (even on failure).
Closing for now. Hoping someone else comes up with a better fix.

A lot of the test runs are failing due to this and we are blindly resetting each failing test run, thus missing actual test failures. We need to either fix the underlying bug or restore the previous behavior.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16324](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16324.html) (Get cs_main out of the critical path in Pro

I'd really prefer we at least attempt to fix InvalidateBlock to fix the issue in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16444#issuecomment-514801708 before we jump to removing CheckBlockIndex. Ideally we'd capture this case in CheckBlockIndex directly.

> I'd really prefer we at least attempt to fix InvalidateBlock to fix the issue in #16444 (comment) before we jump to removing CheckBlockIndex. Ideally we'd capture this case in CheckBlockIndex directly.\n\nAgreed -- please see #16849.
Maybe comment that check can fail if header is not accepted. Could quote or link to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16444#issuecomment-514801708
